section.title: Why is this setting necessary?
section.para: At startup of an Eclipse application the Eclipse platform restores the state in which you left the application before the last shutdown. During development this might lead to situations where changes are not correctly applied and displayed, e.g., you define a new menu entry and this entry is not displayed in your application.

Alternatively to the approach described above, you can also set the Clear flag on the Main tab in your Run configuration. This would also delete other persisted data, like for example preference values.
